channel.title: School next year
channel.description: So I'm going to DigiPen Institute of Technology. I went to some private school for my first year out of HS, but I'm transferring to DigiPen. How many have you heard of this school? I get mixed crowds who've heard it and who haven't (mostly haven't). Where are you guys going next year if you are graduating this year? Where are you going now if you already graduated from HS? Let's get some higher education talk up in here!

item.title: School next year
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

i’ll be a sophomore in high school…

item.title: School next year
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:27, topic:442031”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=544681.msg3994354#msg3994354 date=1337051757]

Finishing up my Sophomore year online, sticking with school on the internet.

Wow… that has to suck real bad.

I’m on my second to last year of high school and then I’m off to college. Still not sure what I want to be but I am going to study nearly everything I can really. Would you recommend dorms or flatting?
[/quote]It is suprisingly really easy, you just need the self discipline which I lack. I have to finish 55 lessons in like 8 days. :D[/quote]

What about the social aspect?

Read full topic

item.title: School next year
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:15, topic:442031”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=544681.msg3992975#msg3992975 date=1336855543]

I’m only going into my Junior year of highschool next year, so college is pretty far away. I’ll probably try to go to UCONN/UMASS or somewhere close. I’ve been thinking about pursuing a career in Psychology, but I’m not sure.

I realize this topic was for people graduating this year, but it’s posted in forums where the average age is ~12, so I decided to post anyway ;p.

I’m finishing up my Junior year right now, and trust me, college isn’t far away at all… I thought the same thing at the start of this year :\

Anyways, I’m looking at Saint Vincent College after high school. It’s looking pretty good too, as I’ve received personal invitations to things from the chairman of the CIS dept.
[/quote]

Interesting. CIS?[/quote]
Computing & Information Sciences Department

http://cis.stvincent.edu/

Read full topic

item.title: School next year
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

mopman_sucks:

It sounds similar to fullsail, I have two friends that went to fullsail, one of them loved it and is very successful landed a job with zynga the other graduated and does some freelance work but also works at publix because he can’t get himself in the spotlight so to speak. From what I understand its a great school if you are passionate about what you want to do. It’s important to know that you need to be outspoken to succeed in that type of envoirnment it is definantly not for the “quite” type.

BOOM

Read full topic

[/quote]

That’s actually pretty cool. Do you have a linked in profile?

Never heard of it, but the from what I can see from the website, looks like a very interesting place. I plan to either go to Georgia Tech or Miami when I graduate… (I come from Florida)

Interesting choices. What are you planning on studying?[/quote]

It sounds similar to fullsail, I have two friends that went to fullsail, one of them loved it and is very successful landed a job with zynga the other graduated and does some freelance work but also works at publix because he can’t get himself in the spotlight so to speak. From what I understand its a great school if you are passionate about what you want to do. It’s important to know that you need to be outspoken to succeed in that type of envoirnment it is definantly not for the “quite” type.

item.title: School next year
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

CIS is basically your local IT department (not a course of study, if that’s what you mean by comparing it to CS). Handling staff computer upgrades, tech support, software deployment and development, etc. At least that’s what it was at SPU, I’m guessing it’s slightly different for each college or business

Read full topic

item.title: School next year
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

k1ng0frs:

Heading to College I’ll be studying two years of chemistry (inorganic and organic), two years of biology, one or two of English, and maybe one of physics, and some other stuff to earn my way to become a Forensic Pathologist

All I have to say is holy shit. If you can manage that, serious kudos. That’s a really hard workload. Best of luck to you!

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:442031”]I’ve heard of digipen in passing, don’t know much about it.

I’m doing community college for now, lots cheaper and most of the credits are transferable – it’s a good way to get the ‘degree requirements’ like college english, etc out of the way, before going to a university that specializes in something, like technology courses for digipen[/quote]

Naturally, I’ll disagree. If you get all your gen ed’s out of the way and then focus on specialty classes, you’ll run into a lot of problems. For example, you may have an exact course load you need to take each fall, spring, next fall, next spring (especially at small schools) in order to graduate on time. If you spend your first 2 years doing gen eds, but need to do 6 or 7 consecutive semesters of specialty classes to earn a degree. Now you’re going to be in school for 11 or more semesters, rather than 8. Order matters a lot.

And as far as DigiPen goes, they have no general eds. So it wouldn’t matter anyway. :rolleyes:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:13, topic:442031”][quote author=`Alec link=topic=544681.msg3992853#msg3992853 date=1336844884]
I’m only going into my Junior year of highschool next year, so college is pretty far away. I’ll probably try to go to UCONN/UMASS or somewhere close. I’ve been thinking about pursuing a career in Psychology, but I’m not sure.

I realize this topic was for people graduating this year, but it’s posted in forums where the average age is ~12, so I decided to post anyway ;p.
[/quote]
I’m finishing up my Junior year right now, and trust me, college isn’t far away at all… I thought the same thing at the start of this year :\

Anyways, I’m looking at Saint Vincent College after high school. It’s looking pretty good too, as I’ve received personal invitations to things from the chairman of the CIS dept. [/quote]

Interesting. CIS?

item.title: School next year
item.dc:creator: @Bottled_Water Bottled Water
item.description:
@Bottled_Water wrote:

Normal high school sadly ;p.

@Taharok - as far as a profile, I have full administrator privileges on the network (making me somewhat apart of the faculty). I have access to the the switches in 3 different schools. As far as it looks right now, the internship will last until my senior year when I graduate. Over the summer, I will be going from repairing computers (building my own paid off ;)) to doing stuff for my school such as setting up networks, upgrading software, etc.

@milkman - Depends on what you mean by certifying

Read full topic
